alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 6:52PM PST until December 26 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 1 PM PST TUESDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...San Francisco County. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 1 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal levels are running around 1 foot higher than tidal predictions. High tide will peak about 10:07 am PST Tuesday between 7.0 to 7.5 feet above MLLW, resulting in minor coastal flooding for low-lying, flood-prone spots adjacent to the San Francisco Bay.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
